Application Process.deadline: March 1st (applies to both domestic and international students)

test_scores.GRE_GMAT: not required but can be optionally submitted

conditions.GPA_evaluation: only at time of admission review

restrictions.double_dons: cannot be combined with other USF scholarships
restrictions.refugee_grants: no specific grants, external funding recommended

language_requirements.exemptions: bachelor's/master's degree from US or exempted countries

International Students.financial_documentation: Can submit application without complete Certificate of Finance if applying for loans

documentation.enrollment: No green card or documentation required

class_format.sections: multiple sections to keep sizes small

Program Overview.name: Master of Science in Data Science (MSDS)

Program Preparation.experience: prior data science experience beneficial but not required

program_director.name: Shan Wang
program_director.description: Dr. Shan Wang is the program director and an assistant professor in the MS in Data Science program at the University of San Francisco. Her research interests include nonparametric statistics, biomedical data science, and utilizing data-driven methods to address social and environmental problems.
program_director.education: PhD, Statistics, Purdue University, 2015; BS, Mathematics, Fudan University, 2009

administrative_director.name: Aija Tapaninen
administrative_director.description: Aija Tapaninen has been with USF since 2014. Prior to joining the MSDS program team, she has held positions in the Strategic Enrollment Management division and at the School of Management, working with the campus community on a range of topics related to graduate student education. Before USF, Aija was in graduate admissions and student affairs at UC Berkeley and UCLA.
administrative_director.education: University of San Francisco, MBA, 2017; University of San Francisco, MA in Organization & Leadership, 2010; San Francisco State University, BA in Intercultural Communication, 2005

full_time_faculty.name: David Guy Brizan
full_time_faculty.description: David is an associate professor at the University of San Francisco. His research interests are natural language processing, machine learning, and databases â€” specifically on the personal and cultural/demographic information transmitted during speech and typing.
full_time_faculty.education: PhD, Computer Science, CUNY Graduate Center (candidate); MS Computer Science, San Francisco State University; BS Computer & Information Science, Brooklyn College

full_time_faculty.name: Cody Carroll
full_time_faculty.description: Cody Carroll is an assistant professor with joint appointments in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics and the Master's in Data Science program (MSDS).
full_time_faculty.education: UC Davis, PhD in Statistics, 2021; UC Davis, MS in Statistics, 2017; UT Austin, BS in Mathematics, 2014

full_time_faculty.name: Mahesh Chaudhari
full_time_faculty.description: Mahesh Chaudhari is an assistant professor in the MS in Data Science program at the University of San Francisco. His research interests include databases, data engineering and cloud computing.
full_time_faculty.education: Arizona State University, PhD in Computer Science, 2011; Mississippi State University, MS in Computer Science 2003; University of Mumbai, Mumbai, India, BE in Computer Science and Engineering, 1999

full_time_faculty.name: Robert Clements
full_time_faculty.description: Robert Clements is an assistant professor in the MS in Data Science program and the Director of the Center for AI and Data Ethics.
full_time_faculty.education: UCLA, PhD in Statistics, 2011; UCLA, MS in Statistics, 2009; Humboldt State University, BA in Mathematics, 2006

full_time_faculty.name: Stephen Devlin
full_time_faculty.description: Stephen Devlin is a Professor in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics and the Master's in Data Science program (MSDS).

full_time_faculty.name: Mustafa Hajij
full_time_faculty.description: Mustafa Hajij is an assistant professor at the MSDS program at University of San Francisco.
full_time_faculty.education: Louisiana State University, PhD in Mathematics; Louisiana State University, MS in Computer Science; Jordan University for Science and Technology, MS in Mathematics; Damascus University, BS in Mathematics

full_time_faculty.name: Yannet Interian
full_time_faculty.description: Yannet is an associate professor in the Master's in Data Science program, and her research interests lie in the application of machine learning and deep learning to medical data.
full_time_faculty.education: Cornell University, PhD in Applied Mathematics, 2006

full_time_faculty.name: Victor Palacios
full_time_faculty.description: Victor received his master's degree in data science from the University of San Francisco and is currently working in the same field at the University of San Francisco as the Director of Data Science Partnerships.
full_time_faculty.education: University of San Francisco, MS in Data Science, 2021; Nagoya University, MS in Information Science, 2015; UC Berkeley, BA in Japanese, 2011

full_time_faculty.name: James Wilson
full_time_faculty.description: James is a statistics and data science educator, researcher, mentor, and enthusiast. His research merges computational statistics, random graph theory, and machine learning to provide interpretable machinery to model, explore, and analyze complex interacting and imaging systems.
full_time_faculty.education: PhD, Statistics and Operations Research, University of North Carolina, 2015; MS, Mathematical Sciences, Clemson University, 2010; BS, Mathematics and Chemistry, Campbell University, 2008

full_time_faculty.name: Diane Woodbridge
full_time_faculty.description: Diane Woodbridge is an associate professor in the MS in Data Science program at the University of San Francisco. Her research interests include scalable database management systems, data fusion, and machine learning focusing on remote health monitoring (IoT in Healthcare).
full_time_faculty.education: PhD, Computer Science, University of California, Los Angeles; MS, Computer Science, University of California, Los Angeles; BS, Computer Science and Engineering, Sogang University, South Korea
expertise: Machine learning for IoT in Healthcare

part_time_faculty.name: Sundar Dorai-Raj
part_time_faculty.description: Sundar Dorai-Raj has been a data scientist at Google since 2009. He has spent most of his career working on Ads products, from YouTube Ads, where he helped launch YouTube's first skippable ad format, to Brand Lift and Google Analytics.
part_time_faculty.education: Virginia Tech, PhD in Statistics, 2001; Virginia Tech, MS in Statistics, 1999; University of Alabama, MA in Applied Math, 1997; University of Alabama, BS in Applied Math, 1995

part_time_faculty.name: Mark Graves
part_time_faculty.description: Mark Graves has fifteen years experience in developing software, informatics, and data science solutions for healthcare and the pharmaceutical industry.
part_time_faculty.education: Graduate Theological Union/Jesuit School of Theology, MA in Systematic & Philosophical Theology, 2005; University of Michigan, PhD in Computer Science, 1993; Georgia Institute of Technology, MS in Computer Science, 1989

part_time_faculty.name: Stephen Hsu
part_time_faculty.description: Stephen Hsu is a Solutions Architect helping companies end-to-end data projects with experience deriving insights from data to augment decisions in industries such as finance, retail, and healthcare.
part_time_faculty.education: USF MS in Data Science, 2018; UC Berkeley, BA in Cognitive Science, 2017

part_time_faculty.name: Nico Thiebaut
part_time_faculty.description: Drawn to theoretical physics, Nico Thiebaut became an instructor at the University of Paris-Saclay, pursuing a PhD in quantum physics.
part_time_faculty.education: University of Paris-Saclay, PhD in Theoretical Physics, 2015; Ecole Normale Superieur, MA in Condensed Matter Physics, 2011

faculty_emeritus.name: Terence Parr
faculty_emeritus.description: Terence is a professor of computer science and is the creator of the ANTLR parser generator. He herded programmers and implemented the large jGuru developers web site, during which time he developed and refined the StringTemplate engine.
faculty_emeritus.education: Purdue University, PhD in Computer Engineering, 1993; University of Minnesota, Postdoctoral Fellow at the Army High-Performance Computing Research Center
expertise: How programmers communicate with machines to build new software

visiting_faculty.name: Nathaniel Stevens
visiting_faculty.description: Nathaniel is interested in using data to make decisions, solve problems, and improve processes. Specifically, his research interests lie in methodological development at the intersection of data science and industrial statistics.
visiting_faculty.education: PhD, Statistics, University of Waterloo, 2015; MMATH, Statistics, University of Waterloo, 2011; BMATH, Statistics, University of Waterloo, 2010

Student Employment.outside_work: not recommended due to program intensity

health_insurance.waiver: available with proof of comparable insurance

core_programming.description: An intense review of Python programming and an introduction to a variety of computational problems.
This course gives students a comprehensive view of data structures and algorithms.
Students learn the MapReduce technique of distributed computing.

statistics_mathematics.description: A review of random variables, moments, and maximum likelihood estimation.
This course is an intensive introduction to linear models.
This course is an intensive introduction to the existing methods for time series forecasting.

machine_learning.description: This course focuses on the implementation and application of supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms.
Students study advanced machine learning algorithms.
This course introduces students to a range of topics and concepts in deep learning.

data_management.description: This course aims to develop a strong understanding of relational database concepts.
This lab-heavy Python class teaches students how to collect, merge, and clean data from multiple sources.
Students study key-value store through NoSQL with a focus on using MongoDB.

professional_skills.description: Students will learn essential concepts related to business communication.
Students develop a minimum viable data science product.
This course introduces ethical and privacy problems in data collection, algorithms, and evaluation.

practicum_series.description: The data science practicum is a data science project sponsored by a company and mentored by a faculty member.

projects.selection: students form teams and rank preferences
